RAN - Regional Arterial Networ?k. Identify and provide strategic improvements on a core network of arterials that connect urban and activity centers which improves regional mobility throughout King County. (Regional Arterial Network)
Improve Transit Speed and Reliability
Improve Transit HUBS and Transit Centers.

Capacity projects

Important social goals
Promote efficient use of roadways, avoid adverse impacts to businesses and households
Efficiency: use what we have wisely
Preservation: keep what we have safe and useable
Expansion: grow capacity so more people and goods can move
Smart Growth: improve access in urban areas where density and development are greatest
Financing: Establish a higher level of predictable and user based funding

"Provide users a ""missing"" travel mode"

Improve the efficient movement of freights and goods through a significant reduction in travel time

Encourage further development in the center

"Reduce modal conflicts, achieve a ""seamless"" system"

More efficient movement of transit, freight, cars and nonmotorized trips to and between centers
Increase mobility for people and goods by providing congestion relief in high priority corridors.
Stress regional, multimodal approach to providing coordinated improvements instead of spot improvements
Support coordination between jurisdictions

Small to moderate cost investments (goal)
Bus zone relocation or consolidation

Continue to look for means to improve efficiencies and cost effectiveness
PM peak hour non-transit trips (KC Indicators) - Number of person, trips, exclusive of transit trips, currently carried on project roadway/facility
PM peak hour transit trips - number of transit trips currently carried on the project roadway/facility
Freight movement - number of tons carried on roadway/facility
Improves traffic flow/reliability - project provides operational changes that improve vehicle flows for all modes/users of the roadway/facility

Improves HOV movement/HOT lane potential - the project improves HOV lane performance, provides other HOV priority treatments and/or supplements existing HOV lanes so that future use as HOT lane facility is possible
Improves transit movement/reliability - project includes transit specific elements such as transit or BAT lanes, queue jumps, signal priority, or exclusive ROW
Improves freight movement/reliability - project includes freight specific elements such as truck climbing lanes or grade separation targeted at freight movement
Preserve capacity - project repairs or replaces facilities or replaces transit fleets at or nearing end of uesfulness
Increase SOV capacity - project increases capacity for general purpose travel on the roadway/facility
Increase HOV capacity - project adds HOV capacity by adding HOV lanes or completing HOV lane connections
Increase transit capacity - the project increases transit capacity by adding vehicles and/or service
Mix of roads and public transportation

Rational project phasing
